meanings.definition: To burn (a dead body) to ashes.
meanings.sent1: The family was cremating their beloved pet after it passed away.
meanings.sent2: The funeral home offered cremating services for those who preferred it.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally knocked over the candle, cremating the curtains in the living room.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the sun seemed to be cremating everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic eruption was so powerful that it was cremating everything in sight.

meanings.definition: To reduce (something) to ashes by burning.
meanings.sent1: The fire was so hot that it was cremating the old wooden shed in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The forest fire was cremating acres of trees, leaving behind only ashes.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally left the bread in the oven too long, cremating it to a crisp.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the bonfire was cremating marshmallows to perfection.
meanings.sent5: The dragon's fiery breath was capable of cremating entire villages.

meanings.sent3: The careless camper ended up cremating their dinner over the roaring campfire.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the sun seemed to be cremating everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith was cremating the metal to mold it into a new shape.
